title: Install the game on my Windows PC
description: As a Windows PC gamer, I want to run a simple, guided installer for Monopoly Tycoon, so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors, and start playing right away.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have downloaded the standalone installer executable for Monopoly Tycoon, when I run the installer and accept all default options by clicking 'Next' through the wizard, then the installer copies all game files to the default program files directory, a progress bar is shown, a completion screen appears, and the game launches successfully.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am running the installer on a machine where the target drive has less than the required 2 GB of free space, when I click the 'Install' button, then the installer must display a user-friendly error message stating that there is insufficient disk space and halt the installation.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am logged into a standard Windows user account, when I run the installer executable, then the Windows User Account Control (UAC) prompt must appear, requesting elevation to administrative privileges.
technical_tasks: WI-005: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing on all target platforms. The installer is a single, digitally signed executable. The uninstaller is verified to work correctly.

title: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC user installing the game, I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory so that I can manage my disk space and organize my installed applications according to my personal preferences.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer and has reached the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user clicks the 'Browse...' button, selects a valid directory on a different drive (e.g., 'D:\Games'), and proceeds with the installation, then the installer successfully installs all game files into the 'D:\Games\MonopolyTycoon' directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user selects a different drive, then the UI accurately displays the total disk space required for the game and the available disk space on the currently selected drive, updating dynamically.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user selects a directory on a drive where the available space is less than the required space, then the installer displays a clear error message stating 'Insufficient disk space' and the 'Install' button is disabled until a valid location is selected.
technical_tasks: WI-005: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The Inno Setup script correctly handles the custom directory path. Manual testing confirms installation to various custom paths is successful.

title: Provide an option to create a desktop shortcut during installation
description: As a new player installing the game, I want to see a checkbox option to create a desktop shortcut during the installation process, so that I can easily find and launch the game directly from my desktop after it's installed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer, when the user leaves the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option (checked by default) and completes the installation, then a shortcut named 'Monopoly Tycoon' with the correct game icon is created on the user's desktop.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a desktop shortcut was created via the installer, when the user double-clicks the desktop shortcut, then the Monopoly Tycoon game application launches successfully.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is running the game installer, when the user unchecks the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option and completes the installation, then no shortcut for 'Monopoly Tycoon' is created on the user's desktop.
technical_tasks: WI-005: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The installer script correctly creates the shortcut with the right icon and target path. The option is checked by default.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
description: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose and fix the bug.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is running and an unhandled exception occurs, when the global exception handler catches the exception, then a modal error dialog is displayed, blocking interaction with the game window.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the error dialog is displayed, when the user views the dialog content, then the dialog contains a non-technical message (e.g., 'An unexpected error has occurred'), a unique Error ID, and the full, absolute path to the user's log directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an unhandled exception has been caught, when the exception is processed by the logging system, then a log entry at the 'ERROR' level is written to the log file, containing the full exception details (message, stack trace) and the exact same Error ID shown in the dialog.
technical_tasks: WI-002: Integrate Serilog for Structured Logging, WI-003: Implement Global Unhandled Exception Handler
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The handler catches exceptions from different parts of the application. The error dialog UI is clear and provides all required information.

title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC user who no longer wishes to keep the game installed, I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space, ensuring my system remains clean.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is successfully installed, when the user navigates to 'Apps & features', selects 'Monopoly Tycoon', and clicks 'Uninstall', then the uninstallation wizard is launched and completes successfully.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has completed the uninstallation, when the user checks the system, then the main installation directory, desktop shortcut, and Start Menu folder are all deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game application is currently running, when the user attempts to launch the uninstaller, then the uninstaller displays a clear error message stating the game must be closed before proceeding.
technical_tasks: WI-005: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The uninstaller removes all application files and registry keys. The process handles running applications and UAC correctly.

title: Choose to keep my personal data upon uninstallation
description: As a Windows PC Gamer who needs to uninstall the game, I want to be given a clear choice to keep or delete my personal game data (like save files and player profile) during the uninstallation process so that I can reinstall the game later without losing all my progress and achievements.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data in '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon', when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'No' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files are removed, but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory remains untouched.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is installed and personal data exists, when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'Yes' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files AND the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory are also deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is installed but has never been run (no personal data exists), when the user runs the uninstaller, then the uninstallation process completes successfully without presenting a prompt to remove personal data.
technical_tasks: WI-005: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The uninstaller script correctly presents the choice and acts upon the user's selection. The default option is to keep data.

title: Start a new game from the main menu
description: As a player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen, and the main menu screen is no longer visible or interactive.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player uses keyboard navigation to focus on the 'New Game' button and presses the activation key, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button multiple times in quick succession, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen only once, without errors.
technical_tasks: WI-021: Develop Main Menu UI
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The transition to the Game Setup screen is smooth and completes in under 1 second. The button is visually responsive and keyboard accessible.

title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents from a choice of one, two, or three, so that I can customize the game's challenge, duration, and overall experience to my preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I select '2' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, then a new game session is created with a total of three players: one human and two AIs.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I navigate to the game setup screen for the first time, when the screen finishes loading, then a default value (e.g., '2' AI opponents) is pre-selected in the UI.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I change the selected number of AI opponents from '1' to '3', then the UI dynamically updates to display configuration sections for three distinct AI opponents.
technical_tasks: WI-022: Develop Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The UI control for selecting opponent count is clear and functional. The game state correctly reflects the number of players chosen.

title: Set a unique difficulty level for each AI opponent
description: As a Human Player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each of my AI opponents so that I can customize the game's challenge to match my skill level and desired experience, enhancing replayability.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Game Setup screen and have selected 3 AI opponents, when I set the difficulty for 'AI 1' to 'Easy', 'AI 2' to 'Hard', and 'AI 3' to 'Medium', then the UI must clearly display the selected difficulties for each AI respectively.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the Game Setup screen, when I increase the number of AI opponents from 1 to 2, then a new UI section for 'AI 2' appears, and its difficulty selector defaults to 'Medium'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have configured a game with two AI opponents set to 'Easy' and 'Hard', when I start the game, then the internal PlayerState objects for the two AIs must be initialized with 'ai_difficulty' properties of 'Easy' and 'Hard' respectively.
technical_tasks: WI-022: Develop Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Selected difficulties are correctly passed to the game state upon starting a new game. UI controls are independent for each AI.

title: Create a player profile with a custom name
description: As a new or returning player, I want to create a personal profile by entering a custom name, so that my game progress, historical statistics, and high scores are saved and displayed under my unique identity, enhancing my sense of ownership and achievement.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a valid name (e.g., 'BoardwalkKing') and proceeds with game setup, then a new player profile is created and persisted with the entered name and a unique internal profile_id.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has successfully created a profile with the name 'CashMoney', when the game starts, then the human player's name is displayed as 'CashMoney' in the main game HUD.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters or more than 16 characters or special characters, then a user-friendly validation message is displayed and the game setup does not proceed.
technical_tasks: WI-022: Develop Game Setup Screen, WI-039: Set Up SQLite Database and Statistics Repository
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Profile name is validated according to rules. The profile is successfully created and persisted in the SQLite database.

title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
description: As a player setting up my profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid, so that I can easily correct it and proceed to start the game without frustration.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Al'), then a specific error message 'Name must be at least 3 characters long' is displayed below the input field.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name containing special characters (e.g., 'Player!@#'), then a specific error message 'Name can only contain letters and numbers' is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has entered an invalid name and an error message is currently displayed, when the player edits the name so that it meets all validation criteria, then the error message disappears, and the option to proceed becomes enabled.
technical_tasks: WI-022: Develop Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Validation occurs in real-time. Error messages are specific and clear. The 'Start Game' button state is tied to the name's validity.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
description: As a returning player, I want to access a dedicated screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games, so that I can track my performance, see my win/loss record, and feel a sense of long-term progression and achievement.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has completed at least one game, when the player selects the 'Player Statistics' option from the main menu, then a statistics screen is displayed showing correct values for all tracked metrics (Total games played, wins, etc.).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has created a profile but has not completed any games, when the player navigates to the 'Player Statistics' screen, then the screen displays all statistical categories with appropriate default values (e.g., 'Total Games Played: 0', 'Win/Loss Ratio: N/A').
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has existing statistics, when the player completes and wins a new game, then the 'Total Games Played' and 'Total Wins' statistics are correctly incremented, and the 'Win/Loss Ratio' is recalculated.
technical_tasks: WI-039: Set Up SQLite Database and Statistics Repository, WI-040: Implement End-of-Game Statistics Tracking, WI-041: Develop Player Statistics and Top Scores UI
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Statistics are correctly updated after wins and losses. Data is fetched from the SQLite database and displayed in a clear, formatted way.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity and feel more connected to the game experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player clicks on an available token (e.g., 'Top Hat'), then the token becomes visually highlighted, and a preview is shown next to the player's name.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has selected a token and configured a game with AI opponents, when the player starts the game, then the AI opponents are each assigned a unique token from the pool of tokens not selected by the human player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player selected the 'Battleship' token during game setup, when the main game view loads, then the player's 3D game piece on the board and their icon in the HUD is the 'Battleship'.
technical_tasks: WI-022: Develop Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The UI for token selection is intuitive. AI opponents are assigned unique, non-conflicting tokens. The selected token is correctly represented in-game.

title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
description: As a human player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice, so that I can determine the number of spaces my token will move and proceed with my turn.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn and they are in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the system generates two random integers between 1 and 6, a 3D dice animation is shown, and the game state transitions to the 'Movement Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is an AI player's turn or the human player is not in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the game state is updated, then the 'Roll Dice' button is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, when the result of the two dice is identical values (e.g., 3 and 3), then the system correctly identifies the roll as doubles and sets a flag for an extra turn.
technical_tasks: WI-008: Implement Dice Rolling Service, WI-031: Implement Core Gameplay Animations
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Dice rolls are generated using a cryptographically secure method. The dice animation is smooth and respects game speed settings. The button state is correctly managed.

title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
description: As a player, I want to see my game token animate its movement from one space to the next after I roll the dice, so that I can visually track my progress around the board and have an immersive, intuitive gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player's token is on 'St. Charles Place' (index 11), when the player completes a dice roll with a total of 5, then the token animates moving sequentially across 5 spaces, landing on 'Indiana Avenue' (index 16), and the camera smoothly follows the token's movement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has set the 'Game Speed' to 'Instant', when the player's token needs to move, then the token instantly teleports to the destination space without a sequential movement animation, accompanied by a brief visual effect.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's turn results in them being sent to Jail, when the game logic directs the player to Jail, then the token plays a special, direct animation from its current space to the 'In Jail' section of the board, bypassing normal movement.
technical_tasks: WI-009: Implement Token Movement Controller
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Token movement is smooth and accurate. The animation respects game speed settings and handles special cases like 'Go to Jail' correctly.

title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
description: As a player (human or AI), I want to be granted an immediate, additional turn after I roll doubles, so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules and provides an authentic gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is a player's turn and their consecutive doubles count is 0, when the player rolls doubles, then the player completes their move and action, the game state confirms it is still the same player's turn, and their consecutive doubles count is incremented to 1.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has just rolled doubles, when the player rolls again and the result is not a double, then the player completes their move and action, their consecutive doubles count is reset to 0, and the turn passes to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, when the player rolls doubles to get out of jail, then the player moves and completes their action, but their turn ends and they are NOT granted an extra turn.
technical_tasks: WI-007: Develop Turn Manager State Machine, WI-008: Implement Dice Rolling Service
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The game's turn manager correctly handles the extra turn logic and the special exception for getting out of jail. The doubles counter is managed correctly.

title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn, so that the game correctly enforces the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is taking their turn and has already rolled doubles twice in a row, when the player rolls the dice for a third time and the result is doubles, then the player's token is immediately moved directly to the 'In Jail' space and their turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has rolled doubles twice and is on a space near GO (e.g., Boardwalk), when the player rolls their third consecutive double, then the player's token is sent directly to Jail and does not collect the $200 GO salary.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has rolled doubles consecutively, when their next roll in the same turn is not doubles, then the player moves normally, their turn ends, and their consecutive doubles counter is reset to zero.
technical_tasks: WI-008: Implement Dice Rolling Service, WI-010: Implement GO, Jail, and Free Parking Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The consecutive doubles counter is tracked correctly across a single player's turn sequence. The player is sent to jail immediately on the third double without moving.

title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
description: As a Player, I want my cash balance to be automatically credited with a $200 salary when my token passes over or lands on the GO space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player's token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 5, causing their token to move past GO and land on 'Baltic Avenue' (space 3), then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player's token is on 'Park Place' (space 37) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 3, causing their token to land exactly on 'GO' (space 0), then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's token is on a space before GO, when the player lands on the 'Go to Jail' space or draws a 'Go to Jail' card, then the player's token is moved directly to the 'In Jail' location and their cash balance remains unchanged.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement GO, Jail, and Free Parking Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Salary is correctly awarded for both passing and landing on GO. The exceptions for being sent to jail are correctly handled. The transaction is logged.

title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
description: As a player who is in jail, I want to be presented with the option to pay a $50 fine at the beginning of my turn, so that I can immediately get out of jail and continue my turn normally.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of $1500, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options and I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $1450, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed to the Pre-Roll Management phase of my turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of $49, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options, then the 'Pay $50 Fine' option is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of exactly $50, when I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $0, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed with my turn.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement GO, Jail, and Free Parking Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The option to pay is only available with sufficient funds. Upon payment, the player's state is correctly updated, and they can proceed with a normal turn.

title: Get out of jail by using a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
description: As a player who is in jail and owns a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, I want to be presented with the option to use it at the start of my turn, so that I can get out of jail immediately without spending money.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 1, when the player selects 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card', then their 'status' is updated to 'Active', their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count becomes 0, and they proceed with a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player uses a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card that originated from the Chance deck, when the action is confirmed, then the specific 'Get Out of Jail Free' card is placed at the bottom of the Chance card deck.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 0, when their turn begins, then the UI option to 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card' is not displayed or is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement GO, Jail, and Free Parking Logic, WI-012: Implement Chance and Community Chest Deck Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The option is only available if the player has a card. Using the card correctly updates the player's state and returns the card to the correct deck.

title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
description: As a player in jail, I want to choose the option to roll the dice on my turn, so that I can attempt to get out of jail for free by rolling doubles.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in jail and it is the start of my turn, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the result is doubles, then my player status is updated from 'InJail' to 'Active', my token moves the number of spaces shown on the dice, and my turn ends without an extra roll.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in jail and it is the start of my turn, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the result is not doubles, then my 'jail_turns_remaining' is decremented by 1 and my turn immediately ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is the start of my turn and my status is 'InJail', when the pre-roll management phase begins, then a modal UI dialog is presented with my available options, including a 'Roll for Doubles' button.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement GO, Jail, and Free Parking Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The logic for getting out and staying in is correct. The special rule of not getting an extra turn on the doubles roll is enforced.

title: Be forced to pay the fine after failing to roll doubles for 3 turns in jail
description: As a player in jail for my third consecutive turn, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine if I fail to roll doubles, so that the official game rules are enforced.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, and they have more than $50, when the player rolls and the result is not doubles, then the player's cash is reduced by $50, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves the number of spaces shown on the dice.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state and their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, when the player rolls and the result is doubles, then the player's cash is not changed, their status changes to 'Active', their token moves, and their turn ends without an extra roll.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, and they have less than $50, when the player rolls and the result is not doubles, then the player is prompted to raise funds by mortgaging properties or selling buildings to cover the $50 debt before movement occurs.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement GO, Jail, and Free Parking Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The forced payment on the third failed roll is implemented correctly. The system correctly integrates with the asset liquidation/bankruptcy flow if funds are insufficient.

title: Draw a Chance card when landing on a Chance space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Chance space, so that the game follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player has $1000 and the top card is 'Bank pays you dividend of $50', when the player lands on a Chance space, then a UI element displays the card, the player's cash becomes $1050, and the card is placed at the bottom of the deck.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has 0 'Get Out of Jail Free' cards, when the player lands on Chance and draws the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, then the player's 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count becomes 1, and this card is removed from the deck cycle until used.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has $10 cash and no mortgagable assets, when the player draws the 'Pay poor tax of $15' card, then the standard bankruptcy process is initiated.
technical_tasks: WI-012: Implement Chance and Community Chest Deck Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. All 16 standard Chance cards are implemented correctly. The deck is managed correctly (shuffling, returning cards). Card data is loaded from an external file.

title: Draw a Community Chest card when landing on a Community Chest space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Community Chest space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw a card instructing them to collect money (e.g., 'Bank error in your favor. Collect $200'), then the player's cash balance is increased by $200.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, then the player's 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is incremented by one, and the card is removed from the deck until it is used.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw a card like 'It is your birthday. Collect $10 from every player', then the active player's cash balance increases by ($10 * number of opponents), and each opponent's cash balance decreases by $10.
technical_tasks: WI-012: Implement Chance and Community Chest Deck Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. All 16 standard Community Chest cards are implemented correctly. The deck is managed correctly. Card data is loaded from an external file.

title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% of my net worth for Income Tax
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear choice between paying a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth when I land on the Income Tax space, so that I can make the most strategic financial decision.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player's token lands on the 'Income Tax' space, when the movement phase concludes, then the game flow pauses and a modal dialog is displayed to the player with the two payment options.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has $500 cash and properties/buildings worth $1500 (Total Net Worth = $2000), when the Income Tax dialog is displayed, then it must present choices for a flat '$200' and a calculated '10% of Net Worth' valued at '$200'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has $100 cash and a total net worth of $1500, when the player selects either the '$200' or '$150' option, then the game initiates the asset liquidation flow, requiring the player to mortgage properties or sell buildings to cover the chosen debt.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Tax Space Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The net worth calculation is accurate. The choice is presented in a clear modal dialog. The system integrates correctly with the bankruptcy flow for insufficient cash.

title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player has a cash balance greater than the Luxury Tax amount, when the player's token lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the fixed tax amount is automatically deducted from the player's cash balance.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has a cash balance less than the Luxury Tax amount but owns assets, when the player lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the game flow is paused, and the player is prompted to manage their assets to pay the debt.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has a cash balance less than the Luxury Tax amount and cannot raise sufficient funds, when the player lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the player is declared bankrupt to the Bank.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Tax Space Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The correct fixed amount is deducted. The system correctly integrates with the asset liquidation and bankruptcy flows for insufficient funds. The transaction is logged.

title: Experience no gameplay effect when landing on Free Parking
description: As a player, I want the game to apply no special action when my token lands on the Free Parking space so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in an active turn and has not rolled doubles, when the player's token lands on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged and the game proceeds to the next player's turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in an active turn, when the player rolls doubles and their token lands on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged and the game prompts the player to take their extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is on a space before GO, when the player rolls a number that causes them to pass GO and land on 'Free Parking', then the player's cash balance first increases by $200 for passing GO, and the 'Free Parking' space itself has no further effect.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement GO, Jail, and Free Parking Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Landing on the space has no effect on the player's state. The game correctly handles turn progression based on whether the player rolled doubles.

title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
description: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice, so that I can proactively adjust my financial position.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the start of the human player's turn, when control is transitioned to the player, then the game enters a 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', the 'Roll Dice' button is enabled, and all property management UI controls are enabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player successfully builds a house and then clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the game state is updated with the build action, the property management controls become disabled, and the game proceeds to the 'Roll Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has just completed a turn where they rolled doubles, when the game grants the player an extra turn, then the game returns to the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', allowing the player to manage properties again before their next roll.
technical_tasks: WI-007: Develop Turn Manager State Machine
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The game loop correctly implements a phased turn structure, pausing for player input at the appropriate time. Management actions are correctly disabled after rolling.

title: Choose to buy an unowned property I land on
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear prompt when I land on an unowned property, giving me the option to purchase it for its listed price, so that I can strategically acquire assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the human player with $1000 in cash, when my token lands on the unowned 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), then a modal dialog is displayed with 'Buy ($140)' and 'Auction' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the property purchase dialog is displayed, when I click the 'Buy' button, then my cash is reduced by $140, 'St. Charles Place' is added to my list of owned properties, and the ownership indicator on the board is updated to my color.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am the human player with $100 in cash, when my token lands on the unowned 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), then the property purchase dialog is displayed, but the 'Buy' button is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-013: Implement Property Purchase Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The purchase dialog is modal and displays correct information. The 'Buy' button is correctly enabled/disabled based on player cash. The transaction is atomic and updates all relevant game state.

title: Choose to send an unowned property to auction instead of buying it
description: As a Human Player, I want the option to decline the immediate purchase of an unowned property I land on so that I can trigger an auction for that property.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the human player and have landed on an unowned property, when the game presents me with the purchase dialog, then the dialog must display two distinct, enabled options: 'Buy' and 'Auction'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the purchase decision dialog is displayed, when I click the 'Auction' button, then the dialog closes and the auction process begins for the correct property, involving all active players.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have landed on an unowned property that I do not have sufficient cash to purchase, when the purchase dialog is presented, then the 'Buy' button must be disabled, and the 'Auction' button must remain enabled.
technical_tasks: WI-013: Implement Property Purchase Logic, WI-014: Implement Property Auction Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The 'Auction' button correctly triggers the auction system. The UI is modal and correctly reflects the player's ability to buy.

title: Participate in an auction for a property
description: As a Human Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I have a strategic opportunity to acquire properties.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress for 'Boardwalk', when the human player places a valid winning bid and all other players withdraw, then the final bid amount is deducted from the player's cash and the 'Boardwalk' property is added to their portfolio.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an auction is in progress and the current high bid is $200, when it is the human player's turn and they have less than $201 cash, then the 'Place Bid' button is disabled, leaving 'Withdraw' as the only available action.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an auction is started by Player 2 in a 4-player game, when the auction begins, then the first player to bid is Player 2, followed by players in clockwise order, skipping any who have withdrawn.
technical_tasks: WI-014: Implement Property Auction Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The auction sub-system correctly manages the bidding loop, enforces bidding rules, and awards the property to the winner. The UI is clear and responsive.

title: Build houses on properties in a complete color set
description: As a player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties so that I can increase the rent value and gain a strategic advantage.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own all properties in the Light Blue color set, have at least $50, and the bank has houses, when I choose to build one house on Oriental Avenue, then my cash is reduced by $50, the bank's house count decreases by one, and a house appears on the Oriental Avenue space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own Oriental Avenue and Vermont Avenue, but not Connecticut Avenue, when I access the property management screen, then the option to build houses on my Light Blue properties is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own the complete Light Blue monopoly but Oriental Avenue is mortgaged, when I attempt to build a house on any Light Blue property, then the action is blocked.
technical_tasks: WI-016: Implement House and Hotel Building Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The system correctly validates all prerequisites for building (monopoly ownership, no mortgages, sufficient cash, bank supply). The transaction updates all relevant game state.

title: Enforce even building rule for property development
description: As a player who owns a complete property set, I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I try to purchase or sell houses, so that the game is fair and follows official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a three-property monopoly where Property A has 1 house, and Properties B and C have 0 houses, when I attempt to build a second house on Property A, then the action is blocked, and the UI provides feedback explaining that I must build evenly.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly one house, when I attempt to build a second house on any single property in that set, then the transaction is successful, and the selected property now has two houses.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 3 houses, and Properties B and C each have 2 houses, when I attempt to sell a house from Property B or C, then the action is blocked, and the UI indicates that I must sell from the property with the most houses first (Property A).
technical_tasks: WI-016: Implement House and Hotel Building Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The validation logic for both building and selling houses correctly checks the development level across all properties in a color set. The UI provides clear feedback.

title: Upgrade a set of 4 houses to a single hotel
description: As a player who has developed a monopoly with four houses on each property, I want to purchase a hotel for each of those properties, so that I can charge the maximum possible rent.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly 4 houses, I have sufficient cash, and the Bank has a hotel, when I initiate the 'Build Hotel' action, then my cash is reduced by the hotel cost, the Bank's hotel count decreases by 1, the Bank's house count increases by 4, and the property's state is updated to have 1 hotel.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where at least one property has 4 houses but another has fewer than 4 houses, when I select any property in that set, then the option to build a hotel is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am eligible to build a hotel but the Bank's supply of 12 hotels is exhausted, when I attempt to purchase a hotel, then the transaction is blocked, and a UI notification informs me of the hotel shortage.
technical_tasks: WI-016: Implement House and Hotel Building Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The system correctly validates all prerequisites for building a hotel. The transaction to swap 4 houses for 1 hotel and adjust bank inventory is atomic and correct.

title: Notify player of building shortage when attempting to build
description: As a player, I want to receive a clear notification when I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels, so that I understand the game state.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Property Management screen, when I attempt to purchase a house and the bank's supply of houses is 0, then the purchase action is prevented and a notification appears with text like 'Cannot build: No houses available in the bank.'
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the bank's supply of houses is 0, when I view my properties in the Property Management interface, then the 'Build House' button(s) for all eligible properties are visually disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the bank's supply of houses was 0, when another player sells houses back to the bank, then on my next turn, the 'Build House' buttons in my Property Management interface become enabled again.
technical_tasks: WI-016: Implement House and Hotel Building Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The UI provides clear, proactive (disabled buttons) and reactive (toast notification) feedback about building shortages.

title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
description: As a strategic player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a building shortage, so that I have a fair chance to acquire these critical assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the Bank has only 2 houses remaining and multiple players wish to build, when a player attempts to build, then the game identifies the shortage and initiates a building auction for the 2 available houses, one at a time.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a building auction is active and it is the Human Player's turn to bid, when the auction UI is presented, then the UI must clearly display the item being auctioned ('1 House'), the current high bid, and allow the player to 'Bid' or 'Pass'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an auction is triggered for 2 remaining houses, when the first house is awarded to the winner, then a new auction for the second house begins immediately, with all original eligible players able to participate again.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Building Shortage Auction
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The building shortage correctly triggers the auction. The auction system handles bidding for individual buildings sequentially. The UI is clear and responsive.

title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
description: As a player managing my finances, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties to the Bank, so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts or fund purchases.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the active player and own an undeveloped and unmortgaged property, when I select the property and confirm the 'Mortgage' action, then my cash balance increases by the property's mortgage value, the property's state is updated to 'mortgaged', and its visual indicator on the board changes.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property with one or more houses on it, when I select the developed property in the Property Management interface, then the 'Mortgage' option is disabled, and a tooltip informs me that all buildings must be sold first.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a mortgaged property, when an opponent's token lands on that property space, then no rent transaction occurs.
technical_tasks: WI-017: Implement Property Mortgaging Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Mortgaging provides the correct cash amount and updates the property's state. The rules preventing mortgaging of developed properties and rent collection are enforced.

title: Unmortgage a property by paying the principal plus 10% interest
description: As a Human Player managing my assets, I want to pay the bank to unmortgage one of my properties so that I can start collecting rent on it again.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own 'St. Charles Place' which is mortgaged (mortgage value $70), when I choose to unmortgage it for $77 and have sufficient cash, then exactly $77 is deducted from my cash balance and the property's state is updated to 'unmortgaged'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a mortgaged property but have insufficient cash to pay the unmortgage cost (principal + 10%), when I view the property in the management screen, then the 'Unmortgage' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have successfully unmortgaged a property, when an opponent subsequently lands on that property, then the correct rent is collected.
technical_tasks: WI-017: Implement Property Mortgaging Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The 10% interest is calculated correctly. The action is only available with sufficient funds. Unmortgaging correctly re-enables rent collection.

title: Initiate a trade with an AI opponent during my turn
description: As a human player, I want to open a trading interface and construct a trade offer involving cash and properties, so that I can strategically negotiate to acquire properties I need.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn, during the Pre-Roll Management Phase, when the player opens the trade interface, selects an AI opponent, constructs an offer, and clicks 'Propose Trade', then the trade proposal is submitted to the selected AI's decision-making module for evaluation.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the human player owns a property that has houses on it, when the player opens the trade interface, then the developed property is not available for selection, with a tooltip explaining that all buildings must be sold first.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is currently an AI opponent's turn, when the human player attempts to access the trade functionality, then the UI button or menu option to initiate a trade is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-019: Implement Player Trading System
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The trade interface can be opened at the correct time. The system correctly validates trade offers (no developed properties, sufficient cash). The offer is passed to the AI for evaluation.

title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear dialog when an AI opponent proposes a trade, so that I can evaluate the deal and decide to either accept or decline it.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI opponent has initiated a trade proposal, when the system presents the offer, then the game flow is paused and a modal dialog is displayed showing the offered and requested assets, with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when the human player clicks the 'Accept' button, then the system validates the trade, atomically exchanges the assets between the players, and the game flow resumes.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when the human player clicks the 'Decline' button, then the trade dialog closes immediately, no assets are exchanged, and the game flow resumes.
technical_tasks: WI-019: Implement Player Trading System
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The AI-initiated trade offer is presented clearly in a modal dialog. Accepting the trade correctly and atomically transfers assets. Declining the trade has no effect on game state.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
description: As a strategic player negotiating with an AI, I want to respond to their trade proposal with a modified counter-offer, so that I can fine-tune the deal to better suit my strategic goals.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI has proposed a trade, when the player clicks the 'Propose Counter-Offer' button, then the trade proposal dialog closes, and the main two-panel trading UI opens, pre-populated with the AI's original offer.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has opened the counter-offer UI and modified the trade, when the player submits the counter-offer, then the AI's evaluation logic is triggered, the AI responds (accepts or declines), a notification confirms the outcome, and assets are exchanged only if accepted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has clicked 'Propose Counter-Offer', when the player clicks the 'Cancel' button within the trading UI, then the UI closes, the original trade offer is considered declined, and the game returns to the state prior to the AI's proposal.
technical_tasks: WI-019: Implement Player Trading System
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The counter-offer flow correctly transitions the UI and pre-populates the trade. The final offer is submitted to the AI for a new evaluation.

title: Receive a non-intrusive notification when AI players trade with each other
description: As a human player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when a trade is completed between two AI opponents, so that I can maintain situational awareness of the game's strategic landscape.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress with a human and at least two AI opponents, when 'AI 1' successfully completes a trade with 'AI 2', then a notification banner appears on the screen with a summary of the trade (e.g., 'Trade Complete: AI 1 traded 1 property to AI 2 for $200').
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a trade notification is displayed, when the notification appears, then the game flow is not interrupted or paused by the notification, and it disappears automatically after a few seconds.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given AI 1 proposes a trade to AI 2 and AI 2 rejects the offer, when the rejection occurs, then no trade notification is displayed to the human player.
technical_tasks: WI-019: Implement Player Trading System
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The notification is non-modal, appears only for completed trades, and provides a clear summary. It works correctly on all game speeds.

title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
description: As a property owner, I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the game rules are enforced fairly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given Player A owns 'Baltic Avenue' (but not a monopoly) and it is not mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Baltic Avenue', then the base rent is automatically deducted from Player B's cash and added to Player A's cash.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given Player A owns an undeveloped monopoly (e.g., the Light Blues), when Player B lands on one of those properties, then double the base rent is automatically transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns 'Indiana Avenue' and it is currently mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Indiana Avenue', then no rent is collected, and no cash is transferred between players.
technical_tasks: WI-015: Implement Rent Calculation and Collection
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Rent calculation is accurate for all property types, development levels, and monopoly states. The mortgage rule is correctly enforced. The system integrates with the bankruptcy flow.

title: Automatically pay rent when I land on an opponent's property
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically calculate and process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property, so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am a player with $1000 cash, when my token's movement ends on an AI's property where rent is $10, then my cash is automatically reduced to $990, the AI's cash increases by $10, and a notification confirms the payment.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am a player with $500 cash and my last dice roll was a 9, when my token lands on an AI's Utility (where the AI owns both), then the rent is calculated as 10 * 9 = $90, and my cash is reduced to $410.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am a player with $50 cash and no mortgagable assets, when I land on an opponent's property where the rent is $100, then the system identifies I cannot pay the debt and initiates the bankruptcy process.
technical_tasks: WI-015: Implement Rent Calculation and Collection
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Rent payment is automatic and accurate for all property types. The system correctly integrates with the bankruptcy flow for insufficient funds. Clear feedback is provided.

title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining
description: As a human player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a distinct and celebratory victory screen, so that my achievement is acknowledged and I feel a sense of accomplishment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, when the last AI opponent is declared bankrupt, making the human player the sole remaining participant, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal Victory Screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when the player views the screen, then it must display a prominent 'Victory!' message, the player's profile name, and key statistics like Final Net Worth and Game Duration.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when the screen first appears, then a victory fanfare audio clip plays and celebratory visual effects (e.g., confetti) are rendered.
technical_tasks: WI-025: Develop End-of-Game Screens, WI-040: Implement End-of-Game Statistics Tracking
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The win condition correctly triggers the screen. The screen displays accurate summary stats and provides clear navigation options to the main menu or full summary.

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
description: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player incurs a debt they cannot pay after liquidating all assets, when the system declares the player bankrupt, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the 'Game Over' screen is displayed, when the player views the screen, then it must contain a prominent header text like 'Game Over' and a single call-to-action button labeled 'View Game Summary'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the human player is viewing the 'Game Over' screen and more than one AI remains, when the player clicks 'View Game Summary', then a high-speed simulation of the remaining AI players' turns begins until a single AI winner is determined, at which point the final summary screen appears.
technical_tasks: WI-020: Implement Bankruptcy Logic, WI-025: Develop End-of-Game Screens
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The loss condition correctly triggers the screen. The flow to the high-speed AI simulation and final game summary is implemented correctly.

title: View a detailed game summary screen after a match ends
description: As a Human Player who has just completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen so that I can review the performance of all players and understand the final outcome.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game has concluded (win or loss), when the Game Summary screen is displayed, then a 'Victory!' or 'Game Over' message is shown, the final winner is visually highlighted, and a statistics section is shown for all players who participated.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Game Summary screen is displayed, when the user reviews the statistics, then the values for 'Final Net Worth', 'Total Rent Collected', and 'Properties Owned' must accurately reflect the final state of the game for each player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Game Summary screen is being displayed, when the user clicks the 'Return to Main Menu' button, then the application navigates to the main menu screen.
technical_tasks: WI-025: Develop End-of-Game Screens, WI-040: Implement End-of-Game Statistics Tracking
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The screen displays accurate final stats for all players. The winner is clearly indicated. The layout adapts to different player counts.

title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD
description: As a player, I want a persistent on-screen display showing the name, token, and current cash for every player, so that I can instantly assess the financial standing of all participants.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a new 4-player game has started, when the main game board scene is loaded, then a persistent HUD is visible with four player panels, each correctly displaying the player's name, token icon, and starting cash of $1500.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a game is in progress, when the game advances to the next player's turn, then the HUD panel for the previous player is de-highlighted, and the panel for the new active player receives a distinct visual highlight.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's cash balance is $1000, when they pass GO and collect a $200 salary, then their cash display in the HUD immediately updates to show $1200.
technical_tasks: WI-027: Develop Main Game HUD
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The HUD displays correct real-time data for all players. The turn indicator updates reliably. The layout is responsive to different aspect ratios.

title: See clear visual indicators of property ownership on the board
description: As a player, I want clear, player-specific visual indicators on each property space on the board so that I can instantly understand who owns what and make faster strategic decisions.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a property on the board is unowned, when a player successfully purchases that property, then a visual indicator corresponding to the purchasing player's unique color/token immediately appears on the property space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player owns a property and its ownership indicator is displayed, when the player mortgages that property, then the indicator's visual state changes to clearly signify it is mortgaged (e.g., becomes greyed-out) while still being identifiable as belonging to the owner.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a bankrupt player's assets are transferred to a creditor player, when the transfer completes, then the ownership markers on all transferred properties immediately change to the creditor player's markers.
technical_tasks: WI-030: Implement Board Visuals and Ownership Indicators
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Ownership markers are updated in real-time for all ownership change events (purchase, trade, bankruptcy). The mortgaged state is clearly and visually distinct.

title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
description: As a human player, I want the game to pause and display a focused, interactive pop-up for critical decisions, so that I can consciously evaluate my options without the risk of missing important game events.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the human player, when I land on an unowned property, then the game's background processes are paused, a modal dialog is displayed showing the property's details, and it presents me with 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given any critical decision modal dialog is active on screen, when I attempt to click on any UI element outside of the modal dialog (e.g., the main HUD), then the clicks are ignored, and only interactions with the elements inside the modal dialog are registered.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given any critical decision modal dialog is active on screen, when I click one of the action buttons within the dialog, then the corresponding game logic is triggered, the modal dialog is closed, and the game state resumes its normal flow.
technical_tasks: WI-026: Develop Modal Dialog System
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The modal system is reusable and correctly pauses/resumes the game state. It successfully blocks background UI interaction. It is used for property purchase, trade offers, and tax choices.

title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
description: As a human player, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view the status of all my properties and take strategic actions like building or mortgaging.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn, before they have rolled the dice, when the player clicks the 'Manage Properties' button in the main HUD, then a dedicated property management screen is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has a complete, undeveloped monopoly and sufficient cash, when the player selects a property from that monopoly and clicks the 'Build House' button, then the player's cash is debited by the correct building cost and the UI updates immediately.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player owns a monopoly where one property has 1 house and the others have 0, when the player selects the property that already has 1 house, then the 'Build House' button for that property is disabled, and an informative tooltip explains that building must be even.
technical_tasks: WI-028: Develop Property Management UI
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The interface provides a consolidated view of all assets. All management actions (build, sell, mortgage, unmortgage) can be initiated from this screen. Action buttons are dynamically enabled/disabled based on game rules.

title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
description: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct and review trade offers.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the trading interface is open, when the player adds one of their properties and a cash amount to the 'Your Offer' panel, and adds one of the AI's properties to the 'Their Offer' panel, then all selected items appear correctly in their respective panels and the 'Propose Trade' button becomes enabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trading interface is open and the player owns a property with at least one house, when the player attempts to select the developed property to add to their offer, then the property is visually disabled in the selection list and cannot be added.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI opponent initiates a trade with the human player, when the trade offer is presented, then the same two-panel interface appears, pre-populated with the AI's offer, and buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' are displayed.
technical_tasks: WI-029: Develop Two-Panel Trading UI
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The UI clearly separates the two sides of the trade. It allows easy addition/removal of all asset types. It performs real-time validation for trade rules (no buildings, sufficient cash).

title: Access an in-game settings menu
description: As a player in the middle of a game, I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match, so that I can adjust game options, save my progress, or exit the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, when the player presses the 'Escape' key or clicks a 'Settings' icon on the HUD, then a settings menu overlay is displayed and the game simulation is paused.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the in-game settings menu is open, when the player views the menu, then it must contain distinct, clickable options for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', and 'Return to Main Menu'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a modal dialog (e.g., a trade offer) is displayed to the player, when the player attempts to open the settings menu, then the settings menu does not open, and the modal dialog remains the focus.
technical_tasks: WI-024: Develop Settings Menu
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The menu correctly pauses and resumes the game. It provides access to all required sub-menus and actions. It does not conflict with other modal dialogs.

title: Adjust the game speed to make animations faster or instant
description: As an experienced player, I want to change the game speed setting so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions, allowing for a faster-paced game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in a game, when the player navigates to the settings menu and selects the 'Fast' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations (e.g., dice rolls, token movement) play at an accelerated rate.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant' and the human player is involved in a property auction, when the auction begins, then the game speed is automatically and temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction and reverts afterward.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has set the game speed to 'Fast', when the player saves the game, exits, and then loads that saved game, then the game speed setting is correctly restored to 'Fast'.
technical_tasks: WI-024: Develop Settings Menu
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The speed settings (Normal, Fast, Instant) correctly affect all relevant animations and delays. The auction override works as specified. The setting is persisted in save files.

title: Adjust master, music, and sound effect volumes independently
description: As a player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels so that I can customize the game's audio to my personal preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Music' volume slider, then the volume of the background music changes in real-time to match the slider's value, and the new setting is immediately persisted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Sound Effects' volume slider, then a sample sound effect is played at the new volume level, and the new setting is immediately persisted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has set the Music volume to 30%, when the player closes the game and then relaunches it, then the game's music level is at 30% and the sliders in the settings menu reflect the saved value.
technical_tasks: WI-024: Develop Settings Menu, WI-032: Implement Comprehensive Audio System
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The three volume sliders (Master, Music, SFX) work independently and provide real-time audio feedback. The settings are persisted locally between game sessions.

title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
description: As a Data-Conscious Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores after a confirmation prompt, so that I can have a clean slate.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I navigate to the settings menu, click the 'Reset All Player Data' button, and click 'Confirm' on the subsequent confirmation dialog, then all my historical player statistics are reset to their default zero state.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have existing data and have opened the deletion confirmation dialog, when I click the 'Cancel' button, then the dialog closes and no data is modified or deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the reset confirmation dialog is displayed, when I view it, then the dialog text explicitly states that the action is permanent and cannot be undone.
technical_tasks: WI-024: Develop Settings Menu, WI-039: Set Up SQLite Database and Statistics Repository
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The feature requires explicit confirmation. The reset operation correctly and completely clears the relevant tables in the SQLite database for the active profile.

title: Provide a bulk deletion option for all saved games via the settings menu
description: As a user who wants to manage my game data, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, with a confirmation step, so that I can easily clear out old progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user has at least one saved game file, when the user clicks the 'Delete All Saved Games' button in settings and confirms the action, then all files within the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory are permanently deleted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has opened the deletion confirmation dialog, when the user clicks the 'Cancel' button, then the dialog closes and no files are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user has no saved game files, when the user navigates to the settings menu, then the 'Delete All Saved Games' button is visibly disabled and cannot be clicked.
technical_tasks: WI-024: Develop Settings Menu
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The feature requires explicit confirmation. The operation correctly removes all files from the saves directory. The button state is managed correctly.

title: Start an optional interactive tutorial to learn the game
description: As a new player, I want to start an optional, interactive tutorial so that I can learn the basic rules and game controls in a guided, hands-on environment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the main menu, when the user clicks the 'Tutorial' button, then the game transitions to a dedicated, scripted tutorial game state.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the tutorial has started, when the tutorial prompts the player to roll the dice by highlighting the 'Roll' button, then all other UI elements are non-interactive until the player clicks the highlighted button.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has completed the final guided action in the tutorial, when the final action is confirmed, then a 'Tutorial Complete' modal dialog is displayed with options to 'Start New Game' or 'Return to Main Menu'.
technical_tasks: (Implied by REQ-1-081)
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The tutorial guides the user through a scripted sequence covering core actions. User input is restricted to the current tutorial step. The tutorial can be exited at any time.

title: Access and search a digital rulebook from game menus
description: As a player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from both the main menu and the in-game pause menu so that I can quickly find and clarify specific game rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in an active game, when the player opens the pause menu and clicks the 'Rulebook' button, then the rulebook UI is displayed as a modal overlay and the game is paused.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the rulebook UI is open, when the player types a keyword (e.g., 'mortgage') into the search bar, then the list of rules is dynamically filtered to show only the sections containing the keyword.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the rulebook's source JSON file is missing or malformed, when the player attempts to open the rulebook, then a user-friendly error message is displayed (e.g., 'Rulebook data could not be loaded.'), the rulebook UI does not open, and an ERROR is written to the log file.
technical_tasks: (Implied by REQ-1-082, REQ-1-083)
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The rulebook is accessible from both menus. The search function works correctly. The content is loaded from an external, structured data file.

title: Save game progress into one of several save slots
description: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn, so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing from the same point at a later time.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in an active game and it is the start of my turn (before rolling), when I open the pause menu, select 'Save Game', and click on an 'Empty' save slot, then the complete current GameState object is serialized into a versioned JSON file with a checksum.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'Save Game' menu and I click on a slot that contains a previously saved game, when a confirmation dialog appears and I select 'Yes', then the existing save file for that slot is replaced with the new game state data.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is an AI player's turn OR it is my turn but after I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, then the 'Save Game' button is visually disabled and is not clickable.
technical_tasks: WI-023: Develop Save/Load Game Screens, WI-037: Implement GameState Serialization and Deserialization
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The save option is only available at the correct time. The entire game state is serialized correctly. Overwriting saves requires confirmation. Save files are versioned and include a checksum.

title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
description: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu and have at least one valid saved game, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, select the valid save slot, and confirm, then the system deserializes the game state, and the game is perfectly restored to the moment it was saved.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when the list of save slots is displayed, then each occupied and valid slot must display metadata such as the player's profile name, the date/time of the save, and the turn number.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen and at least one save file has failed its checksum validation, when the list of save slots is displayed, then the slot corresponding to the corrupted file is visually marked as 'Corrupted' or 'Unusable' and is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-023: Develop Save/Load Game Screens, WI-037: Implement GameState Serialization and Deserialization
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Loading correctly restores the full game state. The load screen accurately displays metadata for each slot. Corrupted or incompatible saves are handled gracefully.

title: Continue playing my saved games from older versions of the application
