description: As a Returning Player with a saved game from a previous version, I want the application to automatically update my save file when I load it, so that I can continue my progress without losing it after a game update.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have a save file from a compatible older version of the game, when I select to load that game, then the system detects the old version, automatically and atomically migrates it to the current version's format, and then loads the game successfully.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the data migration process is underway, when an unexpected error occurs, then the migration is aborted and the original, untouched save file is preserved.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have a save file from a version that is too old to be migrated, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, then the save slot is marked as 'Incompatible Version' and is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-038: Develop Save File Data Migration Mechanism
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The migration process is atomic and robust. The system can distinguish between migratable and non-migratable old versions. Successful migration preserves all user data.

title: View a list of my top 10 victories
description: As a competitive player, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen from the main menu, so that I can review my most successful victories and be motivated to beat my own records.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has won 10 or more games, when the player selects 'Top Scores' from the main menu, then a screen is displayed showing a list of exactly 10 entries, sorted by Final Net Worth (descending).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has won fewer than 10 games, when the player navigates to the 'Top Scores' screen, then the list displays exactly the number of victories the player has achieved.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the database contains two victory records with the exact same Final Net Worth, when the player views the 'Top Scores' screen, then the victory achieved in fewer turns is ranked higher.
technical_tasks: WI-039: Set Up SQLite Database and Statistics Repository, WI-041: Develop Player Statistics and Top Scores UI
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The screen correctly queries and displays the top 10 scores from the SQLite database. Sorting logic, including tie-breakers, is implemented correctly.

title: Export my top score history to a text file
description: As a competitive player, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple, human-readable text file, so that I can easily share my achievements with friends or keep a personal record.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the 'Top Score History' screen, when the player clicks the 'Export to Text' button and selects a location in the native Windows 'Save As' dialog, then a '.txt' file is created at the specified location.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a high score file has been successfully exported, when the user opens the exported '.txt' file, then the file contains a clear header and each score entry is on a new line with all data fields (Rank, Name, Net Worth, etc.) clearly labeled and matching the in-game UI.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is viewing the 'Top Score History' screen and the list is empty, when the player views the screen, then the 'Export to Text' button is visibly disabled and not clickable.
technical_tasks: WI-041: Develop Player Statistics and Top Scores UI
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The export function uses a native save dialog and produces a well-formatted, accurate text file. The button state is managed correctly.

title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
description: As a player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes for the game, so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player selects a new theme and confirms the selection, then all in-game assets, including the game board, player tokens, UI/HUD elements, and background music, are updated to the new theme without requiring a game restart.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has selected a theme and closed the application, when the player launches the game again, then the game starts up with the previously selected theme already active.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the assets for a theme are corrupted or missing, when the player attempts to switch to that theme, then the theme change fails, the game remains on the previous theme, and an ERROR level log is written.
technical_tasks: WI-033: Implement Theming System
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The theme system can dynamically load and unload visual and audio asset packages. The player's choice is persisted between sessions. The system handles missing assets gracefully.

title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
description: As a Game Player, I want to be notified in a non-intrusive way when a new version of the game is available upon startup, so that I can easily access the latest features and bug fixes.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have an older version of the game and an active internet connection, when I launch the application, then the game performs a version check asynchronously and a non-intrusive notification is displayed on the main menu indicating an update is available with a clickable download link.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have the latest version of the game installed, when I launch the application, then no update notification is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I do not have an active internet connection or the version check endpoint is unreachable, when I launch the application, then the version check fails silently in the background, no error message is displayed, and the game loads normally.
technical_tasks: (Implied by REQ-1-097)
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The update check is non-blocking and fails gracefully. The notification is clear and provides a direct link to the download page. No data is automatically downloaded or installed.

title: View the game's data privacy statement
description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to access and read a clear data privacy statement from the main menu, so that I can understand what data the game collects and confirm that it operates entirely offline.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the main menu screen, when the user clicks the 'Privacy Policy' button, then a modal view appears, displaying the game's data privacy statement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user reads the content, then the text must explicitly confirm that the application operates entirely offline, all user-generated data is stored locally, and no data is transmitted to any external server.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user clicks the 'Close' or 'Back' button, then the view is dismissed, and the main menu becomes interactive again.
technical_tasks: (Implied by REQ-1-098)
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The statement is easily accessible. The content is loaded from an external resource file and accurately reflects the game's offline nature.
